Source   Edit  

This module implements parsing of OSC messages.

Types

OscMessage = object
  address*: string
  params*: seq[OscValue]
Source   Edit   
OscParseError = object of CatchableError
Source   Edit   
OscTime = object
Source   Edit   
OscType = enum
  oscFloat, oscInt, oscString, oscBlob, oscTrue, oscFalse, oscNil, oscArray,
  oscTime, oscBigInt
Source   Edit   
OscValue = object
  case kind*: OscType
  of oscInt:
    intVal*: int32
  of oscFloat:
    floatVal*: float32
  of oscString:
    strVal*: string
  of oscBlob:
    blobVal*: string
  of oscTrue:
    nil
  of oscFalse:
    nil
  of oscNil:
    nil
  of oscArray:
    arrayVal*: seq[OscValue]
  of oscTime:
    timeVal*: OscTime
  of oscBigInt:
    bigIntVal*: int64
Source   Edit

OscTimeImmediate = (seconds: 0'u, frac: 1'u)

proc parseMessage(data: string; ignore_unknown: bool = false): OscMessage {.
    ...raises: [OscParseError], tags: [], forbids: [].}
Parse the given data into an OscMessage object. Raise an OSCParseError if the data is invalid. Source   Edit   
proc toOscTime(time: Time): OscTime {....raises: [], tags: [], forbids: [].}
Convert the given time to an OSC/NTP Timestamp. Source   Edit   
proc toTime(time: OscTime): Time {....raises: [], tags: [], forbids: [].}

Convert the given OSC/NTP timestamp to a Time object.

This conversation is lossy. Doing a round-trip will have a deviation of 1 nanosecond. See test/times.nim for the test that shows that.

NOTE: This does not handle the special case of an immediate time. You have to check using isImmediate yourself.

Source   Edit
